definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause to be emotionally shocked ; to cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset .
( transitive ) To give an electric shock to.
( transitive ) To subject to a shock wave or violent impact .
examples: Ammonium nitrate can detonate if severely shocked .

definitions.definition: ( obsolete , intransitive ) To meet with a shock ; to collide in a violent encounter .
( transitive ) To add a chemical to (a swimming pool ) to moderate the chlorine levels .

( geology , transitive ) To deform the crystal structure of a stone by the application of extremely high pressure at moderate temperature , as produced only by hypervelocity impact events, lightning strikes, and nuclear explosions .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause to be emotionally shocked ; to cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset .

( transitive ) To subject to a shock wave or violent impact .
( obsolete , intransitive ) To meet with a shock ; to collide in a violent encounter .
( transitive ) To add a chemical to (a swimming pool ) to moderate the chlorine levels .

( geology , transitive ) To deform the crystal structure of a stone by the application of extremely high pressure at moderate temperature , as produced only by hypervelocity impact events, lightning strikes, and nuclear explosions .

definitions.definition: To collect, or make up, into a shock or shocks; to stook .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To collect, or make up, into a shock or shocks; to stook .
